inn1.comm: gets good bounce first up, angling this into the ribs. Hafeez defends, Shehzad wants a single, but is sent back
full and outside off this time, there is some posthumous swing there. Left alone
the first ball was short but straight, the second full but wide. This is short and wide, and Hafeez cuts it away for four
full and straight, hit towards mid-on, who is very close to the stumps
length ball around off, defended solidly
wide of the crease, just short of a length, around off, Hafeez stays on the crease and pushes this back to the bowler
sharp bouncer to start off with, Michael Holding is impressed with the direction, over the top of off. Left alone
fuller this time, but still short, Shehzad gets behind it and defends
RR is in good form here. Short again, gets it to rise chest high, Shehzad looks to fend at it, but drops the wrists when he sees the extra bounce. The only problem with this was, it was outside off
another peach, and this time it is on the stumps, Shehzad is forced to fend at it. He is hit on the gloves, but it goes straight down into the pitch
fuller, wider of off, left alone. Relief for Shehzad after those four testing deliveries
punched away from a shortish length, but not past cover
Roach is not as menacing as Rampaul today, and Hafeez pulls him comfortably
fuller this time, pushed to mid-on
nice shot, a push drive, leaning into a wide delivery, guiding it between cover and extra cover
back of a length, outside off, helped away to third man for a single
Shehzad gets a bouncer from Roach too. He sways out of the line, bat stays down. Well negotiated
back of a length, around off, solidly behind it
shortish, outside off, not quite the cutting length, left alone
angled into the ribs, played down towards square leg
left on length, it was pitched just outside off, jagged back in a little, but bounced over the off stump
fuller, but wide, and Hafeez is cautious. Doesn't play at it
fuller, closer to off, but left alone again. Judging the line well
another maiden from Rampaul. They are circumspect playing him. Defends this length ball to cover
Shehzad finally off the mark, whipping this past midwicket after moving across the stumps
Lovely off-drive on the up. It wasn't quite the driving length, but he hit through the line, and bisected the bowler and mid-off

What a catch from Bravo (thank goodness at least he is not down in India). Running behind, watching it over his shoulder, and then diving full length. The response to the driven four is natural: a short delivery. Shehzad gets a chunky top edge, which seems to be flying over square leg. Bravo runs backwards, keeps his eye on the ball, and then dives at the last instance, getting both hands to it. First wicket of the series for Roach
short again, but too straight, and easily pulled away to long leg
starts well, with a forward defensive right off the middle of the bat
played with an open face to point
back of a length, pushed to cover
shortish, into the pads, played to square leg
short delivery outside off, left alone watchfully
the second run off Rampaul, and hardly convincing at all. Extra bounce around off and he is forced to fend. The shoulder of the bat takes it over the cordon and down to third man
fuller this time, wide enough for Hafeez to not have anything to do with it
closer to off, making him play. Hafeez defends solidly
driven on the up, with a slightly open face to place it wide of mid-off
good punch shot as the bounce gets a bit big. Hits it on the up, places it wide of mid-off
ducks under this bouncer, called one for the over
drops this to point and runs, good early call means there is no trouble in making the single
slower ball, which compensates for the fact that it was a half-volley. Played cautiously to square leg
Hafeez pulls disdainfully a delivery similar to the one Shehzad top-edged. Right on top of this, placing it wide of square leg
stays short, chest high, Shafiq gets on top of the bounce, and keeps it down
another bouncer, Shafiq ducks under it
quick single here, dropping it towards cover and charging through
Hafeez is pretty comfortable with the short stuff, at least when it doesn't go higher than the chest. He pulls this one over square leg
fuller, on the pads, clipped away nicely through midwicket for another couple
short outside off, not much width to cut it, hence pushed away to cover
starts with a short delivery, shapes up to hook, but the ball doesn't quite come on, and decide against playing the shot
fuller delivery, just outside off, again the ball stops a touch. Played uppishly towards cover
angling into the pads, rolls off the pad for a leg-bye
appeal fr lbw, Asoka says not out, and rightly so as this is sliding down the leg side. The batsman has missed out on a boundary opportunity, though, as this was a gentle length ball on the pads
pushed through the cover field for a single
short outside off, left alone, loopy bounce, falls in front of the keeper
on the pads, hit straight to square leg
hooks the bouncer away, gets a top edge, but it falls of deep backward square
fuller, around off, played towards cover-point
just short of driving length, around off, no room, defended back to him
another delivery in that off and thereabouts channel, pushed back to the bowler
gets closer to the stumps, but Hafeez is watchful in defence
way down the leg side, also bouncing short of the keeper. Well done by Baugh to not concede any byes
good bounce there from a not very short length, Shafiq rides the bounce and keeps it down
Bravo is excited as this hits something on the way down the leg side, but in any case it doesn't reach the keeper on the full. Looked like glove to me
leg-stump half-volley, not hit convincingly, and straight to midwicket anyway
short, into the ribs, gets inside the line and works it around the corner
back of a length, outside off, guided down to third man
around off, short of driving length, played back to Bravo
starts on target, length ball, off stump and just outside, defended back to Sammy
extra bounce beats him as he looks to run this down to third man
slower ball, gets him playing in front of his body, uppishly towards straightish extra cover
steered away to third man for a single
Nearly caught and bowled, the ball holds up again, the shot goes uppishly back towards the non-striker, Sammy dives full length to his right, but hi fingers can't quite get there
the release shot over mid-on, Shafiq has been caged by some good bowling, and this time he takes the risk and goes over the infield
length, into the pads, worked away for an easy single
bouncer outside off, left alone
good shot, punched away between cover and extra, but the outfield has been further slowed down by the rain
clipped away off the pads, gets a single to long leg
back of a length, middle and leg, pushed to square leg
short and wide, doesn't quite come on, has to roll his wrists on the cut
Could have been run out. Hafeez nicely sold Shafiq down the river, but West Indies refuse to buy him. He played this point, called Shafiq through, then sent him back. Bravo missed on the direct hit
almost similar result, but this time the "no" is early
cut away to third man for a single
on the pads, can't beat square leg
into the pads again, worked around the corner
slower ball, too full, driven to mid-off for a single
wide ball, square-driven wide of sweeper-cover. Hafeez turns blind for a second, and makes it comfortably

Out of nowhere comes a six! Slightly across the line, fetching a length ball from outside off to over long-on. Mikey Holding: "Normally we would say this has sent the crowd scattering, but there is no crowd."
slight off cutter, aimed at off stump, pushed back to Bravo
nicely played, once too often the change-up bowlers have strayed onto the pads, and Hafeez flicks him fine of deep square leg
pulled away this time, nicely rolling his wrists on it, getting a single
slower ball, but too straight with the fine leg up. Luckily, for Bravo, he finds the very fielder
runs this shortish delivery down to third man
Disdainful pull. Gentle pace for a short delivery, he gets into position early and smacks it past midwicket
slower ball outside off, pushed towards cover
slower ball again, another near return catch, but the check shot goes wide enough off Sammy
slightly short, just outside off, defended towards cover
overpitched, driven down to long-on for one
good start, flighted delivery outside off, dipping and turning, takes a thick edge past backward point
generously flighted again, drawing him into a forward defensive
stays back to an in-between length, plays it to point
drives him forward again, defended with soft hands for a stop-start single, but they make it
the top spinner, but too short, and is easily pushed down to long-off
legbreak pitching leg and turning towards off, worked around the front pad for a single to square leg
Sammy stays accurate, gets an inside edge onto the pad
backs away a touch, but can't manufacture room, and pushes this back to the bowler
played with an open face to point
slower ball on the pads, gets a single to long-on
pushed between point and cover, gets a single
length ball, around off, played back to Sammy
length ball, around off, slight turn away, defended
fuller and quicker, defended to cover
Fifty for Hafeez with a single to covers. His second of the series. Shafiq shakes his hand. Hafeez raises his bat to the dressing room
a rather loose stroke, stretching too far to drive this, but gets a single off the outside half of the bat
nice late-cut, from pretty close to off stump, but he uses the bowler's pace. The outfield, though, has slowed down, and it will only be a couple
flighted legbreak, pushed to cover
cut away to third man for a single
gentle short ball, pulled away along the ground
steered down to third man
length ball outside off, pushed to extra cover
slower ball, driven nicely past extra cover, gets a couple
another slower ball, short of driving length this time, and hence defended back to him
nice legbreak, dipping a bit, pitching middle and leg, turning away. Played watchfully
pulls the length back a touch, making him reach for it, gets the edge, but it falls well in front of second slip
Whoa! He moves away a long away, exposing all three stumps, somewhat like Salim Malik used to do to unsettle bowlers. Drives this from leg line for a single wide of cover
quicker through the air, defended to point
straighter delivery, left alone outside off
authoritative sweep, the bat comes down on it, making sure it goes along the ground, and he has placed it perfectly between deep square and deep midwicket
length, outside off, pushed to cover

Lovely throw from Samuels from deep midwicket. Long hop pulled wide of deep midwicket. Samuels comes around, makes a one-handed pick-up, and fires it in top of off, on the full. The replays say he has just about managed to make it in
fuller now, no room, and defended solidly to cover
nicely flicked away off the pads for a single
slower ball outside off, cautiously negotiated
misfielded by Darren Bravo at straightish extra cover, allowing them a single
overpitched on the pads, pushed down to long-on for one
makes room, and drives him down to long-off for another single
quicker one, angling into the pads, played to midwicket
looks for the late-cut, finds point
overpitched again, driven to long-on

Hit on the helmet! Don't worry, this is not a bouncer. He is looking for the paddle sweep, the ball falls short of his reach, and then bounces, taking the glove on the way to the helmet. Doesn't fall too far square, but Baugh is looking towards fine leg. And the slip has just been moved out
Sammy stays in the channel, just short of driving length, just outside off, defended
opens the face on this, but can't beat point
slower ball, Hafeez has gone too far across, but checks the shot well, and takes a single wide of midwicket
looks for the cut, the slowness of the ball means it takes the underside edge into the ground
cut away fine, Edwards does well to run to his left at third man and keeps them down to two
loopy slower ball on the pads, sweeps it, but can't beat short fine leg
paddled away from well outside off, gets a single to square leg
another premeditated paddle, beaten by the turn. Shafiq hasn't looked comfortable at all
this is better, driving a full ball down the ground
quicker one into the pads, played straight to midwicket
short and wide, cut away in front of square
moves well away from the stumps again, Bishoo bowls a yorker, which he digs back to him
starts off with a wide down the leg side
on the pads, worked away for an easy single
nice short ball, rising towards the chest, but equally well played as he rides the bounce and drops and runs
another bouncer, rolls his wrists on the pull, gets an easy single
stays low, beating an attempt to flick, but it is headed down the leg side, and the appeal is rightly turned down
full on the pads, worked away for an easy couple
length ball, outside off, pushed to cover
legbreak outside off, left alone
similar delivery, looks for the late-cut, but can't beat third man
quicker one, but this time they steal the single to short third man
another premeditated paddle, hit on the glove again, but the ball falls safe
short ball, there is some bounce, which makes the cut an uppish shot. They take the single to sweeper-cover
full ball, driven to straight extra cover
length ball, into the pads, played to midwicket
driving length outside off, but the feet don't go. However, the inside edge misses the stumps
pulls the length back a bit, results in a forward defensive
nice and wristy, this angled into the pads, and he helped it between mid-on and midwicket
pulled along the ground, rolling his wrists nicely on it
full on off, defended to cover
Shafiq is freeing up now, another wristy shot. This was on the pads all right, but he made sure he glanced it really fine. Fine enough to go to the fence despite the slow outfield
slower bouncer, shapes up to hook, but let is be
overpitched on the pads, flicked away nicely
short ball, steered down for a single
full and wide, gets too close to the pitch of the ball
the last ball is short, and is pulled away uppishly, however it falls short of deep square
full on the pads, driven to mid-on, who is inside the circle
looks to work this to on from around off stump line, gets a leading edge that falls short of extra cover
slower ball, steals a single to mid-on
pulled away, again keeps it down, all along the ground
runs this down to third man
lovely yorker, that's classical Roach, going after the toe, which he has to save with some frantic foot movement
and extra bounce right away, bouncing over the slashing bat of Shafiq's
Hint of reverse? Swinging in from outside off, bat face closes as he drives it to midwicket
swinging in again, not sure if it is reverse, defended back to the bowler
short outside off, opens the face on it, gets a single to third man
pulled away in the air, off the front foot, but falls short of the deep fielder
drops and runs, Sammy runs in from point, but can't make a clean collection
looks for the third man area, but guides it to point
slower bouncer, but wide outside off
slower ball, but fuller, defended off the front foot

another fumble with a run-out in sight. This time it is the other Darren - Bravo. Again it was a tip and run, Bravo swooped in from midwicket, but didn't collect the ball properly. A hard-earned half-century for Shafiq
pushed to cover
back of a length, punched to cover, another dot

Dropped. Half-chance it was, and would have been a Bravo special had he held on. It was a low full toss, hit back hard at him, Bravo went down in the follow through, but the ball popped out as he hit the ground
inswing again, driven wide of long-on, but they get just the single
high full toss, but not high enough to be called a no-ball. They get a single to third man
another fumble by Sammy at point. They would have taken the single anyway
full inswinger, heaved away to long-on for one
pulled away, rolling his wrists over it, gets another single
slower ball, gets the inside edge onto the pad, but it falls safe
full ball, slight swing, gets the inside half of the bat, they come back for two
slower ball, driven down to long-on for another single
back of a length, pushed down to long-on for another single
full outside off, driven to long-off
slower ball, outside off, looks to run it down, can't beat point
nicely steered down to third man for another single
defended towards midwicket
quicker delivery, played to cover
another fast delivery, defended again
driven straight to cover
goes inside-out, over extra cover, the slow outfield holds it up
very nice late-cut gets him a couple of runs, nearly from the keeper's gloves
on target again, and played towards midwicket
short and wide, cut away in front of square
slower ball, beats his attempted cut shot
pushed down to long-off
full and wide, nicely driven square of the wicket, wide of the diving point fieldsman
driven to sweeper-cover this time
starts off with a length ball wide of off, driven down the ground for one
closer to off, pushed back to Bravo
Sammy attacks the ball at point, making sure they don't steal a single
back of a length, played wristily down the ground for a single
slower ball, steered away to third man
full ball on the pads, whipped away square, but finds the boundary rider
slower delivery, played in front of his body, towards extra cover
his first uncontrolled pull shot today, but it falls short of Samuels at deep midwicket. Not a top edge, just didn't get hold of it. Wanted to go for a six I think
runs this slower ball off the face of the bat to third man
clears the front leg for this drive, but gets just the single to long-off
pulled along the ground this time, gets a single to square leg
Didn't even land on the pitch. Saw the batsman shaping up to scoop, and wanted to go wide of off. But not this wide
slower ball, accurate this time, concedes the single to long-on
Nice shot, makes room first, then waits for this slower delivery, and then guides it past the short third man, using whatever pace the bowled had given him

And it is the midwicket's coming in that seems to have triggered this wicket. Shafiq seemed to be going over midwicket, but ends up hitting this length delivery just to the right of long-on, who moves well to complete a simple catch
pushes a length ball down to long-off for one
hint of swing into him, whipped away to deep midwicket for one
low full toss on the pads, worked away for a single to deep square leg
full ball, hit powerfully, but straight to short extra cover
slower ball, dropped wide of point for one
slower ball again, Bravo at point attacks the ball to prevent the stolen single

walks down the wicket, Sammy digs it short, Afridi drops it at his feet and wants the single. Hafeez rightly sends him back because Bravo is lurking. The throw, though, hits Afridi's stretched-out bat
slower ball again, looks to run it down, but can't get it wide of the cover
Bravo again in business at short point. This was regulation pace, driven on the move to Bravo, who goes for the run-out, misses, and concedes two overthrows
another slower delivery, so slow that Afridi is done opening his face and closing it again by the time it arrives
full toss, driven to mid-off, brings Afridi on strike
looks to run this down to third man, gets it only as far as point
full toss on the pads, the mis-hit eludes midwicket
Beamer. Afridi swings at it anyhow, and the top edge goes over the keeper's head. Roach is duly warned
Powerplay strikes, Afridi is gone. Good short ball, around his face, Afridi tries to pull of the front foot, ends up hitting it limply to mid-off. Clearly late into the shot
full toss on the pads, flicked away to deep backward square
dabbed away square on the off side
starts off with a slower delivery that concedes a single to point
bouncer, pulled away square on the on side, Roach attacks the ball to keep them down to one
good offcutter, not only does it come back in, it bounces too, cramping him, making him fend. Dot ball
announces the intent to paddle it much in advance, Rampaul bowls the slower ball wide of off, Hafeez does well to make the connection, and fetches two before long-on can get around it
sharp bouncer, Hafeez pulls out of the hook shot. Called a wide for height
slower ball on the pads, and he exposes the fact that fine leg is very square with a fine glance for four runs
Second ODI hundred for Hafeez. Flicks this wide of midwicket, completes the single, scratches the guard, removes the helmet, acknowledges the applause from the dressing room, and does the sajda
full toss again, on the pads, takes the single to midwicket. Had the throw hit, though, Hafeez was a goner here
slower short ball, beats Misbah's attempt at the slash over point
full and straight, just the single to midwicket
This one has set the crowd scattering Mikey. Because now we have crowd in, and Hafeez has hit his second six. This bouncer just sat up, and Hafeez pulled it sweetly over midwicket
once again Hafeez takes the risky single, once again West Indies fail to hit direct. He was a goner at non-striker's end had the throw from point been accurate
slower one again, runs this to point for one
backs away to make room, Bishoo bowls flat, concedes just the single for the cut
clears the front leg looking for the big hit, Bishoo bowls flat and straight, and does the fielding himself as the shot comes back to him
full toss, and Hafeez makes room and gracefully drives it between mid-off and extra cover. Nothing frantic about Hafeez's batting
late-cuts the quicker delivery, but only as far as short third man

this is not quite the classical Misbah dismissal, but is half way there. It is bowled flat, well down the leg side, and would have been wide had Misbah stood his ground. However, Misbah is making room, only to miss it, and let his pads ricochet it onto the stumps
full delivery, swept away to square leg. Another dot
and again, they have missed Hafeez. This is the third time they could have run him out, but they keep missing the stumps. It is Roach this time from mid-off
another dot as Azam mis-hits on the cut shot
heaved away in tailender fashion, hitting it straight to mid-off
walks across the stumps, RR bowls the slower one, goes for a single off the inside edge

that is why they should have taken one of the three run-out opportunities Hafeez has presented after reaching his century. Class shot to move to his personal best. RR misses the yorker by six inches, but he gets under it and lofts him straight into the sightscreen. He can still hurt WI
full, into the pads, worked away to long leg

Bishoo has got the big wicket. Bowled full and straight, near yorker length on leg stump, Hafeez looks to make room to guide it into the off side. Turns out he makes too much room and misses it. Bowled
gets a leading edge first ball as he looks to work a legbreak into the on side. Falls safe

another return catch dropped. Azam looks to drive this to leg, gets the leading half of the bat, Bishoo doesn't expect the catch, looks to save his face, but the ball doesn't come that fast at him. Grassed
Doesn't matter. Bishoo gets the wicket next ball. Leg break that pitches outside leg, Azam looks for the paddle sweep, doesn't go down on it properly, and ends up lobbing it to short fine
full legbreak, around off, defended back to him
another forward defensive out off

Pakistan are crumbling here. Rampaul bowls the slower ball, pushed straight to straightish extra cover, but Salman somehow thinks they should take the single. Salahuddin doesn't budge. Edwards could have smoked a cigarette before taking the bails off at the non-striker's end, Salman was that far away. Classical bullying of the debutant as Salman gives Salahuddin the dirty look when he was himself at fault
runs this down to point for a single
looks to drive but is handcuffed by a straight delivery
back of a length, around off, can't do more than defending it to cover
some inswing, and driven straight to midwicket. Another dot
swept away from middle-stump line, finds the gap to pick up two
worked wide of short midwicket for one
defended off the front foot
pitched outside leg, worked around the corner
flat delivery, hit back to the bowler
ordinary work all around by WI. Roach bowls one of his numerous full tosses today, and then Simmons misfields at deep square to leak two more runs than he should have
length ball, in the tailender's arc, and Tanvir heaves this over cow corner. Six very valuable runs
slower short ball outside off, beats his slog

Pakistan have more silly stuff in store here. Quicker bouncer, pulled away wide of deep square, Salahuddin wants to bring back the big hitter on strike, and comes back for the comfortable second. Tanvir, though, never leaves the non-striker's end. Roach lobs the throw back to the keeper, and Salahuddin is gone
pushes a length ball to long-on for one
slower short ball outside off, beats the heave, and makes sure Ajmal will be on strike first ball of the last over
slower ball, somehow gets the single to midwicket
Tanvir is making up for that run-out. Comes down the track, Bravo bowls the slower ball, it hits the lower quarter of the bat, but the mis-hit somehow clears long-off
this one is even slower, taking ages to come until Tanvir can wait no longer and swings at it, only managing a bottom edge into the stumps. Could be a crucial cameo, though, 18 off 12
full toss on the pads, and the No. 11 just manages the single to fine leg
slower delivery outside off to beat him

All too predictable. The sixth slower ball of the over. Pulled away over midwicket. They look for the third, but Ajmal sends Junaid back. Bravo, though, misses the underarm flick from six feet, and concedes the third too

inn2.comm: worked away off the hips for one

Edwards gone first ball. Slightly strange batting. A very open stance for the left-arm bowler, the ball pitches outside leg, angles away, Edwards hands his bat out, and it kisses the edge on the way through. Squared up by a regulation delivery
Bravo stays on the crease, defends a fullish ball on off
left alone outside off
left alone outside off again
straying on the pads, and Bravo uses Junaid's pace to clip it fine of fine leg for his first runs
length ball, around off, no room, played back to the bowler
back of a length, no room still, stays back to keep it out
Impressive shot, riding the bounce of a short delivery outside off, and then punching it between cover-point and point
similar bounce from just short of a length, this time Simmons leaves it be
fuller this time, pushed to point
Meanwhile they negotiate Tanvir Ahmed's first over in ODI cricket without a wicket, something South Africa and New Zealand couldn't do in Tests and T20s respectively. Left alone outside off
Whoa! That kicked from a length, going head high to the keeper. Left alone outside off, though
full delivery, stays on the crease to defend
wide down the leg side, going too far with the angle. Good diving take by Salman
full, straight, defended back to the bowler
back of a length, outside off, guided to point
guides this one past point to take a single to third man
angled across him, dead-bats it
length ball, pitches leg, ends middle, defended
again on target, Bravo is watchful in defence
shorter, worked away to square leg
fuller, easier to work away off the pads, clipped wide of midwicket
rash shot, this was short of driving length, angled across him, but didn't hive him too much room. He was handcuffed on the loft, but managed to clear mid-off
that's more like what we expect of a Lara clone. On the up, between the bowler and the non-striker, high elbow for the cameras
backs away and slashes at thin air. The ball bounces over his bat

Edged, not taken, Simmons is drawn into hanging his bat at this slower ball wide outside off. The edge is dying and is wide of Salman, who dives to his right, and stretches the right glove in front. Can't quite make it
clipped off the hips, can't beat square leg
punched square on the off side, can't beat point
yorker, digs it out, the ball bounces over Junaid, who fakes a throw but can't deter Simmons from taking the single
slower offcutter, back of a length, stays back in the crease to defend
nice shot, moving across to get close to the line of a wide delivery, then punching it square, between two diving fielders at cover-point and point
Mighty blow! Gentle half-tracker, and Simmons is right back to pull this over midwicket. I suppose he was expecting a short delivery after having charged at Tanvir on the previous ball
Risky shot, but safe shot! This is outside off, and he gives this swing his all, but what he does right is aim over mid-off. Off the toe end the ball fuels, but clears mid-off
steers this down to third man ow for one
back of a length, around off, stays back to defend
moves slightly across to get inside the line of this one, then flicks it fine, but not fine of short fine leg
another impressive punch, on his toes, playing this from ribs-high, into the ground, but can't beat point
pushes this to mid-off with soft hands, and takes an easy single
short ball from wide of the crease, gets a touch big, Bravo drops it at his feet and steals the single
charges at him, Junaid digs it in short, Simmons shapes up for the pull, then decides against it
backs away and slashes this from above the stumps towards third man
pushed to the left of midwicket for one
looks for the aerial off-drive but the extra bounce beats him
this is a fine way to score. Length ball on the pads, clipped wide of short fine. Four runs
nicely steered down to third man for one

Superb improvisation. This shot involves some skill, I suppose. Moves across the stumps, and flicks a length ball over short fine. His front leg, which is now his back leg, is now in air. What's more? It's a no-ball
full and wide, and he stretches and squeezes it over point. Fifty of the partnership comes up. Off 45 deliveries
More punishment. Simmons backs away, manufactures width, and cuts this from just outside off. Doesn't bother about keeping this down, and clears point comfortably
looks for the cut again, but this ball is slightly fuller than the previous one, and beats him
shortish outside off, worked away to leg for one
turned away off the hip for one
ducks under this bouncer bowled from wide of the crease

What a horrible horrible shot! Birthday boy Lara won't approve. This would have been a wide outside off had Bravo not decided to try and hit the leather of it. All he manages is the toe end, which settles with third man for an easy catch
looks to block and run, is sent back because short cover comes charging in
Sarwan is anxious to get off the mark... moves across to play this to square leg. Wants the single, but is sent back
on target, middle and leg, drops it to leg for a single
short, cut away, but can't beat short third
full and quick, played back to Afridi
cut away, but can't get it past point
slower legbreak, pitches leg, turns towards off, defended from deep in the crease
He finally threads the square field on the off side, cutting it to the right of point. He is off the mark too
short, no room, gets on his toes, and hits it into the ground square on the off side
crunchy shot from Simmons again. He just moves a lot but manages to hit them sweetly. Backed away again, and smacked a short ball wide of mid-off

Is it dropped? Walks down the track, turns this short ball around the corner, around the corner was Tanvir Ahmed who didn't go low enough and let it through for four runs too. It surely carried to him
low full toss, hit to mid-on, and he makes the single despite a direct hit from Shafiq
another misfield, Azam at cover-point this time, lets it through in eagerness to collect and throw
yorker, digs it out back to the bowler
shortish legbreak, punched to extra cover

Afridi can't believe Asoka de Silva, he passes the keeper appealing, pleading for this. Googly it is, pitches outside off, hits Sarwan in front. Asoka doesn't give it. replays show extra bounce saving Sarwan
quicker one, wide down the leg side
on the pads,worked away for one

missed stumping? Lovely legbreak to beging with, beats him all ends up. Salman is excited, and in his excitement forgets to remove the bails, and Sarwan seemed to have dragged his foot out. Can't be sure, though
another googly, gets the inside edge this time
cut away from in front of off, and between the two points
flat offbreak to begin with, hits him in the pad
full and flat, played to square leg
shout for leg-before again, beats him with the offbreak, but it seems headed down the leg side
quicker, flatter again, played to midwicket
slow, short and wide, cut away for one
paddled away fine, moves onto 49
stays back to a pitched-up delivery, is hit on the pads, but this is angling down the leg side
short and wide, cut away to sweeper-cover
cut away to deep point, brings up an entertaining fifty, gets a generous applause. Dujon with a gem on air: "His third half-century of the innings. This is the time he normally gets out."
worked around the corner
quick, on the pads, defended
quick again, wide down the leg side, five of them
legbreak outside off, left alone, not interested
straighter one it seems, punched wide of mid-off for a single
full on the pads, flicked away to midwicket
nicely worked away fine for a single
sharp offbreak, beats his bat, but they take the leg-bye - it comes off the thigh pad actually. Good bounce
doosra, seems to have done him in, but very late Sarwan deliberately opens the face and guides it past the slip
full offbreak now, driven to sweeper-cover
cut away to deep point for one
googly, hits him outside the line of off
short of a length, guided to square leg for another single
nice legbreak, tossed up, pitches middle, turns away, defended to cover
again, another legbreak tossed up, defended again
cut away straight to point
sharp offbreak, gets his front pad outside the line as he defends and is beaten
turning into the pads, turned away to short fine
doosra, pitches leg and turns away, defended off the back foot
given width, cut away to deep point
nicely driven, against the turn, square on the off side, gets a couple
stays back to bock a flat delivery
full, on the pads, flicked away for one
close to off, looks to cut, is cramped
finds the gap with the cut, gets a single
googly hits him in the pad from well outside off, has got his front pad outside the line
looks to defend, extra bounce means it goes back uppishly, but bounces in front of Afridi
another googly, extra bounce too, Simmons drops his bottom hand and defends
on the pads, helped away for one
another easy single off the pads
fast offbreak, defended off the back foot
fullish, but he cuts it from in front of off. Still can't beat point
pushed straight to midwicket, who attacks the ball to prevent the single
worked through the leg side for the single that brings the fifty of the partnership. Sarwan has contributed 18 off 36, Simons 25 off 26
runs off the outside edge to short third
too full, on the pads, a single to long-on
cut away, but straight to point
leading edge as he looks to play this around his front pad. Doesn't carry to Afridi
a quick legbreak, defended to cover
too straight, worked around the corner for one
wide down the leg side
punched away to sweeper-cover for one
backs away a long way, then comes back to cover the line of a full offbreak, and tips and runs to point
accurate offbreak, played back to Hafeez
straighter one, too wide, though, and Sarwan cuts it past backward point
moves back to punch this from in front of middle stump, gets a single to sweeper-cover
backs away, comes back to original stance, all this even before Hafeez has delivered. In the end, defends it back
full, on the pads, worked away for a single
sharp offbreak, there is a polite query for bat-pad, but there is not bat involved

looks to tip and run, sends Sarwan back, Salman's throw is a touch wide off Ajmal, who is not there to collect it anyway. Then the throw off the overthrow is also high and above Ajmal. Two separate overthrows off one ball
turned to square leg for one
full and straight, blocked back to the bowler
full, on the pads, can't beat square leg
comes charging at him, Hafeez shortens the length, ends up playing it back
pushed down the ground for one
topspinner, cut away to sweeper-cover
angled into the pads, helped away wide of midwicket
another toppie, cut away again for another single
angled into the pads, concedes the easy single into the leg side
slower ball, easily helped away to long leg
back of a length, around off and middle, defended
angled into the pads, Sarwan plays with an open face towards point
worked away for a single to long leg

That's out of the Kensington Oval! Gentle length ball on the pads, and he has flicked it over square leg, soaring above the Greenidge & Haynes Stand. New ball please. What a blow that was. Takes him to his personal best too
length ball, on the pads, defended
leaps out of the crease, Hafeez bowls short, Sarwan plays it back to the bowler

Sarwan ends what has of late become - and it pains me to say this, because he has been a fine player - a typical Sarwan innings. Eat up a lot of balls, build up the pressure, then hole out. Was looking to hit this over extra, I presume, but ends up hitting straight down long-off's lap - for 28 off 56
worked away off the pads for a single
offbreak, pitches middle, turning towards leg, played to midwicket
another straight offbreak, turned to square leg this time
full on the pads, stylishly flicked away, square enough of long leg to come back for two
drives on the up, the ball doesn't quite come on, goes soft with the hands and keeps it down
pushed with an open face, can't beat point

And West Indies self-combust. One just wonders if one has to do anything more than wait for West Indies to self-combust. Simmons, looking to press on with the scoring, makes room and lofts this length ball straight to deep point. An entertaining innings, but he has left the job unfinished. As Ian Bishop mentions on air, it is not so much the shot that is wrong, but the timing of the shot: in the over immediately after WI had lost a wicket
Samuels is on strike, though, and defends this shortish delivery
beaten outside off, this holds its line slightly
sharp offbreak, turned around the corner for one
goes back, turns it to square leg
Samuels off the mark, pushing this to midwicket
the straighter one, gets a thick edge, but it goes along the ground to cover
offbreak on middle and leg, helped away to fine leg
long hop, and Samules is quick to pounce on it, pulling it over the square leg inside the circle
full, on off, driven straight to mid-off
pushed to long-on this time
back of a length, pushed with an open face, can't get it past cover
similar shot, this time they will take the single after having refused it the last ball

well bowled, heavy ball, quicker than the speed gun will tell you, kicks off a length, gets the inside edge onto the thigh, and Bravo is hit so hard he turns down a certain single towards the thirdman area
good bounce again, pushed to midwicket
full, flat, on off, defended back to Hafeez
charges down and plays it to long-on for one
quick, into the pads, worked away to deep square for one
worked around the corner for another single
turned away to midwicket
full, on the pads, gets a single to long-on
short legbreak, stays back and defends
another dot, quick legbreak, open face

and now they are well ahead of D/L. Long hop, and Bravo pulls it over midwicket. What a well-timed six. Could be the match-winning six. Sammy and Gibson applaud, and then signal a forward defensive. "keep the wicket for the rest of the over."
forward defensive it is
full and straight, another defensive shot
